intro: Dichoropetalum viarium, commonly known as the variable dichoropetalum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-chambered petals, which give it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a showy appearance that attracts pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
